title: Introduction to Programming
shortDescription: Learn the basics of programming with Python.
detailedDescription: This course covers fundamental programming concepts such as variables, control structures, functions, and basic data structures. Students will write Python scripts to solve real-world problems and gain a solid foundation for further studies in software development.

title: Web Development with React
shortDescription: Build modern web applications with React and Vite.
detailedDescription: In this course, you will learn to create interactive and responsive web applications using React, React Router, and Vite. Topics include component-based architecture, state management with useState/useEffect, and integrating external UI libraries like Bootstrap and Material UI to design professional user interfaces.

title: Database Technology and SQL
shortDescription: Fundamental techniques for relational databases and SQL.
detailedDescription: This course introduces concepts in relational databases, ER modeling, and SQL queries. Students will design database schemas, write complex SQL queries to retrieve and manipulate data, and work with transactions and indexing to optimize performance.

title: Mobile App Development with Flutter
shortDescription: Create cross-platform mobile apps with Flutter and Dart.
detailedDescription: In this course, you will learn how to develop mobile applications for both iOS and Android using the Flutter framework. Topics include widget-based UI design, state management with Provider and Riverpod, and integrating REST APIs and local databases. Students will build a complete app from concept to publication.

title: Algorithms and Data Structures
detailedDescription: This course focuses on fundamental algorithms and data structures, including sorting and searching algorithms, trees, graphs, hash tables, and dynamic programming. Students will analyze time and space complexity and implement algorithms in Java to solve advanced problems.

title: UX/UI Design for Web
shortDescription: Principles of user-centered design and prototypes.
detailedDescription: In this course, we explore the fundamentals of user experience and user interface design for web applications. Students learn to conduct user research, create wireframes and interactive prototypes using tools like Figma, and test and iterate designs based on user feedback. The course emphasizes accessibility and responsive design.

title: Machine Learning Basics
shortDescription: Introduction to machine learning concepts and applications.
detailedDescription: This course covers supervised and unsupervised learning algorithms, including regression, classification, clustering, and dimensionality reduction. Students will implement models using Python libraries such as scikit-learn and TensorFlow, and learn how to evaluate model performance on real datasets.

title: Cybersecurity Fundamentals
shortDescription: Learn the essentials of protecting digital systems and data.
detailedDescription: In this course, students will explore core concepts of cybersecurity, including network security, encryption, threat analysis, and risk management. Topics include securing web applications, ethical hacking basics, and developing a security policy for an organization. Practical labs will reinforce best practices for defending against cyber threats.

title: Cloud Computing with AWS
shortDescription: Explore cloud service models and AWS infrastructure.
detailedDescription: This course introduces cloud computing concepts and dives into Amazon Web Services (AWS) core services like EC2, S3, RDS, and Lambda. Students will learn about IaaS, PaaS, and SaaS models, deploy scalable applications, manage cloud resources, and implement cost-optimization strategies.

title: Game Development with Unity
shortDescription: Design and develop 2D and 3D games using Unity.
detailedDescription: In this course, students will learn game architecture, C# scripting, physics, animation, and asset management using the Unity engine. The curriculum guides students through building a complete game project from concept to deployment, covering level design, character control, and user interface integration.

title: Data Visualization and Analytics
shortDescription: Learn to visualize and analyze data using modern tools.
detailedDescription: This course covers principles of data visualization and analytics. Students will build interactive dashboards with tools like Tableau and Power BI, perform data analysis using Python (pandas, matplotlib), and learn how to tell a compelling story with data for business insights. Hands-on projects emphasize real-world datasets.

title: Artificial Intelligence Ethics
shortDescription: Examine the ethical implications of AI systems.
detailedDescription: This course explores the ethical, legal, and social implications of artificial intelligence. Topics include bias and fairness in AI models, privacy concerns, accountability, and transparency. Students will analyze case studies and develop guidelines for deploying AI systems responsibly in various industries.
